metadata.Title: CVE-2022-42799 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The issue was addressed with improved UI handling. This issue is fixed in tvOS 16.1, macOS Ventura 13, watchOS 9.1, Safari 16.1, iOS 16.1 and iPadOS 16. Visiting a malicious website may lead to user interface spoofing.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42799` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.38.2-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.38.2-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-5.0 - 2.38.2-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.38.2-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.38.2-1
gir1.2-webkit2-5.0 - 2.38.2-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.38.2-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.38.2-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.38.2-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-5.0-0 - 2.38.2-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.38.2-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.38.2-1
libwebkit2gtk-5.0-0 - 2.38.2-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.38.2-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.38.2-1').
